Title: 'AI-Powered Remediation': GitHub Now Offers 'Copilot Autofix' Suggestions for Code Vulnerabilities

Title: Paul Allen's Estate Auction Includes Vintage Apple-1, CP/M and DOS-Powered Computers
Details: Posted by EditorDavid on Saturday August 17, 2024 @04:34PM from the famous-co-founders dept. Long-time Slashdot reader [theodp](/~theodp) writes: *Christie's this week announced the items that will be [auctioned in three sales from the Paul G. Allen Collection](https://www.geekwire.com/2024/apple-1-from-steve-jobs-desk-among-items-in-christies-auction-from-late-microsoft-co-founder-paul-allens-collection/), including historic computers and artifacts from the late Microsoft co-founder's [former](https://hardware.slashdot.org/story/24/06/25/2031227/seattles-living-computers-museum-logs-off-for-good) Living Computers Museum + Labs in Seattle...
Category: The category name for the article is 'Tech'.

Title: 2024's Hugo Award Winners Announced
Details: Posted by EditorDavid on Saturday August 17, 2024 @03:34PM from the congratulations dept. Slashdot reader [Dave Knott](/~Dave+Knott) writes: *After once again being plagued by controversy, this time due to [a thwarted ballot-stuffing campaign](https://slashdot.org/story/24/07/24/210224/hugo-awards-organizers-reveal-thousands-spent-on-fraudulent-votes-to-help-one-writer-win), the [2024 Hugo Awards have been awarded](https://www.thehugoawards.org/hugo-history/2024-hugo-awards/) at the 2024 World Science Fiction Convention...
Category: None of the provided category options directly relate to the content described in the article title and details. The Hugo Awards are associated with science fiction and fantasy literature, not with the categories listed. However, if I had to choose the closest related category from the provided options, I would select "Tech" since science fiction often deals with technological themes and advancements. But please note that this is a loose association and not an exact match.

Title: To Fight Censorship Order, X.com Announces It's Ending Business Operations in Brazil
Details: Posted by EditorDavid on Saturday August 17, 2024 @02:34PM from the X-ing-out dept. X.com "says it's ending business operations in Brazil effective immediately," [reports *Engadget*](https://www.engadget.com/social-media/x-is-closing-its-operations-in-brazil-immediately-but-its-service-will-remain-live-for-users-165224020.html), "but the service will remain available to users in the country."...
Category: Tech

Title: Can the US Regulate Algorithm-Based Price Fixing on Rental Housing?
Details: Posted by EditorDavid on Saturday August 17, 2024 @01:34PM from the fix-is-in dept. "Some corporate landlords collude with each other to set artificially high rental prices, often using algorithms and price-fixing software to do it." That's a U.S. presidential candidate, [speaking](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2024/08/16/remarks-by-vice-president-harris-at-a-campaign-event-in-raleigh-nc/) yesterday in North Carolina to warn that the practice "is anticompetitive, and it drives up costs. I will fight for a law that cracks down on these practices."...
Category: Tech

Title: Preparing to Monetize, Threads Launches New Tools for Users
Details: Posted by EditorDavid on Saturday August 17, 2024 @12:34PM from the loose-Threads dept. Category: The category name that fits the article title 'Preparing to Monetize, Threads Launches New Tools for Users' is 'Tech'.
